posts.post_content:
If you'll check the history of my B/S/T posts, you'll see that I try to price items so that they will sell and sell quickly. More often than not that's what happens.
Though I enjoy watching Pawn Stars, I have no desire to live it. Collectors who rely on VCP and the like will notice that some of the cards below are priced above
the average and some below. The reason is because I think some of these are strong for the number on the flip and others are weak.

I promise that I will not be bumping this thread every 36 to 48 hours to announce a 2 percent price reduction. Nor will I bump it to announce whenever a card sells.

Most of these came from a set put together by a collector who had a pretty good eye. The lower-grade cards especially look nice. Please note that I've posted large
scans that are pretty unforgiving. Just about every card below presents very well in hand.

All prices delivered within the United States.

PayPal is fine. No need to "gift" your payment. Checks, money orders and cash are OK, too.

A commitment to buy takes precedence over an ongoing negotiation.  :rolleyes:

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]Feel free to email any questions[/URL].

Thanks,

Rob

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]wolfie51sb at aol.com[/URL]

Piedmonts

Rockenfeld, not slabbed: $95

Persons, SGC 40/3: $105

Westlake, PSA 3: $90

Old Mills

Bastian, SGC 40/3: $105

Bernhard, PSA 4: $195

Carey, SGC 80/6: $695

Elam, SGC 40/3: $149

Foster, SGC 60/5: SOLD

Fritz, SGC 20/1.5: SOLD

Greminger, SGC 60/5: SOLD

Bill Hart, SGC 40/3: $110

Hickman, SGC 60/5: SOLD

Hooker, SGC 30/2: SOLD

Lipe, SGC A: $55

McCauley, SGC A: SOLD

Paige, SGC 40/3: SOLD

Ray Ryan, SGC A: $55

Seitz, SGC 50/4: SOLD

Carlos Smith, SGC 60/5: SOLD

Beautiful cards Rob!  I'll take McCauley if still available.

Rob, I will take Paige.


Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk

Rob,

I will take the Fritz and Hooker.

Thanks,

Mark

Rob, I received the card today. It's a beauty, thanks.
Mike

Rob,

Got the cards today.....look better in person. 

Thanks,

Mark

Thanks, guys, glad you're happy with them.

Because this thread already is bumped to the top, I'll add something I forgot to include in the original post: I'm fairly close to finishing my Piedmont southern league subset and am open to trading for ones I need. So if this interests anyone, feel free to [URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]contact me[/URL].

Thanks.

[URL="wolfie51sb@aol.com"]wolfie51sb at aol.com[/URL]
